issue.title: Handling of fill character width is underspecified in std::format

discussion.p:
doesn't specify if implementations should consider the estimated width of the fill character when substituting it into the formatted results.
For example:

"🤡" (U+1F921) is a single code point but its estimated display width is two.
There are at least three possible resolutions:

li.p: s == "🤡🤡🤡🤡42": use the estimated display width, correctly displayed on compatible terminals.
s == "🤡🤡🤡🤡🤡🤡🤡🤡42": assume the display width of 1, incorrectly displayed.
Require the fill character to have the estimated width of 1.

discussion.p: Resolving this issue should be harmonized with resolving LWG .
